alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Seminole County through 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oviedo, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oviedo, Winter Springs, Lake Jessup, Geneva, and Chuluota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
